page.title: 19GRAFFHAM BLACKSMITH
page.content: He has been a Blacksmith for 24 years. He shoes polo ponies, race horses, show jumpers, hunters & eventers. The most dangerous horse he has shod is a polo pony which he could not get hind shoes on. The highest horse he has shod is a Shire 17.2HH. The shoes he uses are mild steel & ready made. He uses medium heat, enough to shape the shoes. He is from Ireland. He goes out there sometimes for a break. He decided to be a Blacksmith because a jockey was his first choice & love of horses his second choice. He was a part-time apprentice with his father who was a Blacksmith. He shoes 10 horses a day on average, He has had broken ribs & legs, & chipped bones in feet & toes, from his work.
